qas.question: What was the main action of humanism during the Renaissance>
When did a new term for those who followed Humanism emerge?
What was the new term for believers of Humanism philosophy?
Where was one main concentration of Humanism?
What was the main enemy of humanism during the Renaissance?
When did a new term for those who followed Humanism become impossible?
What was the unrecognized term for believers of Humanism philosophy?
Where was there no concentration of Humanism?
What type of philosophy was never taken seriously?

context: Renaissance humanism was an activity of <a0_0><b4_0>cultural and educational reform<b4_0/><a0_0/> engaged in by civic and ecclesiastical chancellors, book collectors, educators, and writers, who by the <a1_0><b5_0>late fifteenth century<b5_0/><a1_0/> began to be referred to as <a2_0><b6_0>umanisti<b6_0/><a2_0/> – "humanists". It developed during the fourteenth and the beginning of the fifteenth centuries, and was a response to the challenge of scholastic university education, which was then dominated by <b8_0>Aristotelian philosophy<b8_0/> and logic. Scholasticism focused on preparing men to be doctors, lawyers or professional theologians, and was taught from approved textbooks in logic, natural philosophy, medicine, law and theology. There were important centres of humanism at Florence, <a3_0><b7_0>Naples<b7_0/><a3_0/>, Rome, Venice, Mantua, Ferrara, and Urbino.
